programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Charente, surprising heritage Exploring the Charente through its unique sites and fascinating characters. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Aioli, halibut, mussels and vegetables Luca Cianciulli presents his aioli and cooks the entire meal in a single pan: halibut, mussels and vegetables. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Émeline and Jérémy, Bas-Saint-Laurent As soon as Émeline and Jérémy learnt that they were expecting a baby, they only had one idea in mind: to settle somewhere close to the sea. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Twenty years of food marketing
What were the most memorable marketing trends of the last twenty years, and what's likely to come next? Should we only eat seasonal fruit and vegetables? Plus: testing oven gloves and all the secrets of the kebab.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Gobelins manufactory - Encounter with Hélène Timsit at the head of the Mazarine fashion house - Exploring New York - Encounter with the glass designer Bernard Pictet Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: L'excellence des boiseries de la maison Féau
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Aveyron, from Aubrac to Larzac A department steeped in authenticity and fascinating contrasts, the Aveyron takes its name from the river that crosses it. Wide open spaces, magnificent gorges, geological treasures, villages brimming with charm, churches, castles built by the Knights Templar: what tourist could resist the Aveyron, its unique heritage and innumerable natural treasures? Directed by: François Chayé (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Des racines & des ailes
programme.desc: The fabulous heritage of the Normans Carole Gaessler welcomes us to the Château de Caen, former capital of the Dukes of Normandy. We discover its major buildings; the Abbaye aux Hommes, founded by William the Conqueror, and the Abbaye aux Dames, established with his wife Mathilde. Then Sicily, where Norman knights built a rich Arab-Norman heritage. Presented by: Carole Gaessler.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 6, episode 32:

Spotlight on "Gems", the exhibition at the Muséum National d'Histoire Naturelle in Paris. All you ever wanted to know about the scrunchie. In Cholet, Équ'inox Exclusive is a flagship of the region's metalwork industry. How to wear a fishnet dress. Portrait of the ceramist Caroline Petit-Mason, founder of Three Seven.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: A sweet experience for Curieux Christian visits Anicet Desrochers in Ferme-Neuve, an internationally-renowned beekeeper. We discover all the honey varieties, used from starters through to desserts thanks to the talented chef Charles-Antoine Crête. Presenter: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: La vigne est belle
programme.desc:
Cultivating friendships
Biodynamic farming is increasingly common among Québec's winegrowers. How do you maximise the yield while also respecting the environment? This is their challenge! While some use their chickens to fight insects, others are diversifying their planting programmes to enrich the soil.
Director: Pascal Brouard (Canada, 2022)

programme.title: Les nouveaux nomades
programme.desc: Taking a trip along the Loire estuary, discovering the elaborate art of braid and trimmings for soft furnishings, visiting the oldest canoe-kayak training centre coaching future champions for both flatwater and white water competitions, tracking down the world's oldest colour photo and its inventor. Presented by: Julie Hattu, Yvan Hallouin, Marine Barnérias, Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: Corsica's East Coast Between Bastia and Porto-Vecchio on Corsica's east coast, we meet Mathieu who grows clementines, a winter fruit packed with vitamins, Antoine and Siham Orsoni give us a taste of brocciu, a local cheese, and Marie Garrido explains why it's so important to save the Isle of Beauty's wetlands. Presenter: Guy Martin.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Aveiro (Portugal) Découverte du marché central d'Aveiro. Présentation : Xavier Petit.
